<html><body><div><div class="entry-content   "><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="NS73SVWNQZABTEYF6NB5XYZSV4">Two climbers were rescued after being stranded in the Rocky Mountains 14,000 feet above sea level. </p><p id="inarticle-1" data-gaid="inarticle-1"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="OHPXMDVLW5EO7MMOFS42VV5ARE">According to the National Park Service, the two climbers were on Kiener’s Route in the Longs Peak area of Rocky Mountain National Park when they requested help from park rangers on Feb. 6. </p><p id="inarticle-2" data-gaid="inarticle-2"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="EAZ36X6VNZEEXFGONAY4UMRNDI">The climbers, 47 and 50, reported they were incapacitated, unable to continue their route, and had not planned to remain overnight. They were rescued on Feb. 7 with rangers maintaining communication overnight, but not without challenges. </p><p id="inarticle-3" data-gaid="inarticle-3"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="73NGKFJDRNGVTAXFWOKCC6W7PA">Air operations were limited due to high winds, officials said. A U.S. Forest Service helicopter attempted a rescue flight but was forced to abort due to wind conditions. A Flight For Life helicopter was also ordered but later stood down for the same reason. </p><p id="inarticle-4" data-gaid="inarticle-4"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="2EJ5XMXUCRFF3I2R3JOXJAHLEU">Finally, at 2:15 p.m., a Chinook helicopter flight crew from the Colorado National Guard Army Aviation Support Facility at Buckley Space Force Base and rescuers from Alpine Rescue and Rocky Mountain Rescue landed on the summit of Longs Peak. </p><p id="inarticle-5" class="middleParagraph" data-gaid="inarticle-5"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="DX3H6SH3UNHAFBUEI7L55WCLZA">The climbers, who had moved to the summit, were located and flown to Upper Beaver Meadows Road within the iconic national park. </p><p id="inarticle-6" data-gaid="inarticle-6"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="L3SNRXTPXFADLLYRRF7DW5RYCA">“Park rangers remind visitors that winter conditions can persist in the high country even when overall snowpack is below average,” a NPS statement said. “Those recreating in alpine environments should plan ahead and be prepared for ice, snow, high winds, and subzero temperatures.” </p><p id="inarticle-7" data-gaid="inarticle-7"></p><p class="article__paragraph article__paragraph--left" id="ANXJBXE34VHZJIVD657Q2VRPT4">Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado is known for towering peaks, alpine tundra, clear mountain lakes, and dramatic scenery made up of mountains, forests and meadows. It features over 60 mountains above 12,000 feet and abundant wildlife like elk and bighorn sheep. </p><p id="inarticle-8" data-gaid="inarticle-8"></p><p id="fusion-static-enter:5F32K4WFBVGWBDG5YGKB3VCN3I" data-fusion-component="5F32K4WFBVGWBDG5YGKB3VCN3I"></p><p id="fusion-static-exit:5F32K4WFBVGWBDG5YGKB3VCN3I" data-fusion-component="5F32K4WFBVGWBDG5YGKB3VCN3I"></p><p id="inarticle-9" data-gaid="inarticle-9"></p></div></div></body></html>
